In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can define the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
            line_length += 1
        end
        result *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end
    return result
end
```

Here's an example usage:

```julia
text = "This is a test text. It needs to be wrapped according to the text width."
println(wrap_string(text, text_width=15))
```

The output will be:

```
This is a 
test text. 
It needs to 
be wrapped 
according to 
the text width.
```
